intro: Guatteria blanchetiana, commonly known as the Mexican pawpaw, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Marcaceae, which includes other species of the genus Guatteria. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-red berry that contains several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
